name: Add debug/reset-state unit tests
notes: debug-broadcaster.valk has debug/reset-state for bulk cleanup on session ID change. No explicit unit tests exist. Add tests verifying: session ID increments, old subscribers get cleaned up, new subscribers work after reset.
accept: Tests verify debug/reset-state behavior in test_debug_handler.valk
reject: No debug/reset-state tests exist in test_debug_handler.valk - missing session ID increment test, old subscriber cleanup test, and new subscribers after reset test

name: Add GC coordination integration test
notes: Create test/test_gc_aio.c that tests GC triggering after aio/start: 1) Start aio, 2) Trigger GC, 3) Verify no hang. Also test allocation after aio/start triggers auto-GC. Use timeout to catch hangs.
accept: Test passes: make build && build/test_gc_aio completes in <5 seconds with exit 0
reject: test/test_gc_aio.c does not exist - only found similar files test_gc_aio_hang.c, test_gc_aio_debug.c

name: Add Cache-Control header test for /debug/metrics/state
notes: Add test verifying Cache-Control: no-cache header on /debug/metrics/state endpoint. Use existing get-header helper.
accept: Test verifies Cache-Control: no-cache header and passes
reject: No Cache-Control header test exists in test_debug_handler.valk - the get-header helper exists but is only used for Content-Type checks

name: Verify test_debug_handler.valk passes without timeouts
notes: After fixes, run build/valk test/test_debug_handler.valk and verify all 31 tests pass with no spurious TIMEOUT messages
accept: All 31 tests pass; no TIMEOUT lines in output
reject: Only 28/31 tests pass; 3 tests have TIMEOUT status: diagnostics/memory SSE second event, diagnostics/memory SSE events valid JSON, Broadcaster multiple connections

name: Fix timeout callback to handle cancel
notes: If aio/cancel doesnt prevent queued callbacks, the timeout callback in *test-async-timeout-callback* needs to check if the timer was cancelled before printing TIMEOUT. May need to add a done-atom or use timer-handle cancelled status.
accept: Timeout callback checks cancel status before printing TIMEOUT

name: Verify timer cancellation fix works
notes: Run test_debug_handler.valk and verify no duplicate TIMEOUT messages after PASS. All 31 tests should pass with no spurious timeouts.
accept: All 31 tests pass; no TIMEOUT lines in output after PASS

name: Initialize async_handle field to nullptr in valk_schedule_timer_t
notes: The current implementation adds async_handle to the struct but does not initialize it to nullptr in __schedule_timer_cb. Need to verify that the field is properly zero-initialized or explicitly set. Check that existing tests pass.
accept: make build && make test passes with no failures related to aio_combinators

name: Fix test_gc_handle_table_growth flakiness
notes: The test passes standalone but fails in full test suite. The BUG message about consecutive allocs too close suggests heap corruption or uninitialized memory. May be caused by aio_combinators changes or a pre-existing issue. Run test isolation to find the cause. Check if any tests modify global heap state.
accept: make test passes reliably (run 3 times consecutively)

name: Add cancellation test for aio/schedule
notes: Add a test that verifies: 1) aio/schedule returns a handle, 2) aio/cancel on that handle sets status to CANCELLED, 3) The callback does not fire after cancellation. Put test in test_aio_timer_unit.c or a new file.
accept: Test passes: schedule a timer, cancel it immediately, verify callback never runs

reason: TSAN reports 10 data races in memory.c and aio_async.c, acceptance requires 0 races
No pthread_create in test - test calls close sequentially, not from 2 concurrent threads
No Content-Type or Cache-Control header validation in test_debug_handler.valk
No slab query param tests (slab=, start=, end=, buckets=) in test_debug_handler.valk
No reset-state tests found in test_debug_handler.valk
test/test_gc_aio.c does not exist - only test_gc_aio_debug.c and test_gc_aio_hang.c exist
Test times out after 30s, doesn't complete in 15s as required
After mem/gc/collect, builtin + is not bound - GC still frees builtins
make test times out after 5 minutes - does not complete successfully
Tests exist for endpoints but do NOT verify HTTP headers. No Content-Type or Cache-Control header assertions found.
test_debug_handler.valk has no tests for debug/reset-state. No session ID increment, subscriber cleanup, or post-reset tests.
